title: The Entreaty
verses: 1. See the judge descending, descending, See the judge descending in that great day; So come, poor sinner, you can't stand his fire, Before that hour, haste thee away.
2. Christians are rejoicing, rejoicing, Christians are rejoicing in this our day; They know their Savior, to Eden's bower, In that blest hour, calls them away.
3. Angels are a shouting, a shouting, Angels are a shouting in this our day; To bear the sinner for Christ inquire With Satan's power draws them the way.
4. Converts are a praising, a praising, Converts are a praising in this our day; That blessed Savior, who in this hour, From Satan's power draws them away.
5. The bride she is a calling, a calling, The bride she is a calling in this our day; She calls you, sinner, with all her power, In this blest hour, O come away.
6. The Savior is a coming, a coming, The Savior is a coming in this our day; Oh come in glory, we'll fall before thee, We'll all adore thee through endless day.

metadata.musical_notation: Present with treble and bass clef
metadata.theological_significance: Urgent plea for sinners to come to Christ before judgment day, emphasizing the joy of Christians, the work of angels, and the church's call to the lost
